frame.name: Roadways
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame involves stable <fen>Roadway</fen>s which connect two stable <fen>Endpoints</fen>, the <fen>Source</fen> and the <fen>Goal</fen>. Being physical objects, these <fen>Roadway</fen>s may have <fen>Name</fen>s and <fen>Characteristic</fen>s; they are also made of a <fen>Material</fen>. They also cover ground, so they may have a <fen>Path</fen> or a <fen>Relative_location</fen> that the travel occurs in.
<ex> We crossed the <fex name="Material">brick</fex> <fex name="Roadway"><t>road</t></fex>.</ex> <ex> I prefer to travel on <fex name="Roadway"><t>highway</t></fex> <fex name="Name">I-80</fex>.</ex> <ex>This is the only <fex name="Roadway"><t>highway</t></fex> <fex name="Endpoints">between Lodi and Sonoma</fex>.</ex> <ex> She dreaded turning onto the <fex name="Frequency_of_use">busy</fex> <fex name="Roadway"><t>street</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Roadway
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Roadway</fen> is the roadway that connects locations.
<ex>The <fex name="Road"><t>road</t></fex> runs between London and Manchester.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is one of the <fen>Endpoints</fen> treated as a source.
<ex>The <t>road</t> <fex name="Src">from london</fex> to Glastonberry...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is one of the <fen>Endpoints</fen> of the <fen>Roadway</fen> treated as a goal.
<ex>The <t>road</t> from London <fex name="Goal">to Glastonberry</fex>...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Endpoints
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Endpoints</fen> are two (or more) named endpoints of the <fen>Roadway</fen>.
<ex>The <t>road</t> <fex name="EPs">between London and Glastonberry</fex>...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Characteristic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a characteristic(s) of the <fen>Roadway</fen>.
<ex>It was a <fex name="Char">long</fex>, <fex name="Char">winding</fex>, <fex name="Char">bumpy</fex> <t>road</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Name</fen> is the name of the <fen>Roadway</fen>.
<ex>We went down <fex name="Name">Abbey</fex> <t>road</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the setting through which the <fen>Roadway</fen> goes.
<ex>The <t>tunnel</t> <fex name="Pat">through the mountains</fex>...</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Use</fen> is the purpose of the <fen>Roadway</fen>.
<ex>This is the main <fex name="Use">traffic</fex> <t>artery</t> out of Berkeley.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Direction</fen> is the direction or directions the <fen>Roadway</fen> runs.
<ex> I-80 is an <fex name="Direction">east-west</fex> <t>highway</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Relative_location</fen> is where the <fen>Roadway</fen> is located.
<ex> The <t>highways</t> <fex name="rel">in California</fex> are the second-worst in the nation.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Material</fen> is what the <fen>Roadway</fen> is constructed from.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency_of_use
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Frequency_of_use</fen> is the state of the <fen>Roadway</fen> with regard to the number of people who are using the <fen>Roadway</fen> or typically use it.</def-root>

FE.name: Abundant_entities
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Abundant_entities</fen> are the entities which occupy the space denoted by the <fen>Roadway</fen>.
<ex> We passed an <t>avenue</t> <fex name="Abundant_entities">of boutiques and restaurants</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition:
<def-root>A subpart of the <fen>Roadway</fen>.
<ex>It was a <t>road</t> <fex name="Part">with too many twists and turns to count</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: trottoir.n
lexUnit.definition: voor voetgangers dat naast de rijweg ligt

lexUnit.name: zebra.n
lexUnit.definition: waar voetgangers de rijweg kunnen oversteken, gemarkeerd door witte brede strepen op het wegdek

lexUnit.name: boulevard.n
lexUnit.definition: meestal langs de zee en soms met rijen bomen beplant in een stad

lexUnit.name: oprit.n
lexUnit.definition: naar een snelweg waarover auto's die weg oprijden
